info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 02 at 4:55PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Catawba and west central Iredell Counties through 530 PM EDT... At 455 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 4 miles northeast of Newton, or near Claremont, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Newton, Conover, Claremont, Catawba, Lookout Shoals Lake, Lake Norman State Park, St. Stephens, Lake Norman, Sherrills Ford and Bandys. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
